senses.sense_definition: A sleeveless garment or part of a garment, hanging from the neck over the back, arms, and shoulders.

examples.text: The superhero flew through the air with a red <w>cape</w> fluttering behind him.
She wore a wool <w>cape</w> over her dress to keep warm in the evening.

senses.sense_definition: A piece or point of land, extending beyond the adjacent coast into a sea or lake.

examples.text: The lighthouse was built on a rocky <w>cape</w> overlooking the ocean.
Sailors had to be very careful when navigating around the <w>cape</w> during the storm.
The city needs more <w>capes</w> to fight the rising crime rates.
He is just an ordinary citizen, not a <w>cape</w> with special powers.

senses.sense_definition: A short form for Cape Cod, a peninsula in Massachusetts, United States, popular for vacations.

examples.text: We are planning to spend our summer holidays at the <w>Cape</w>.
Traffic to the <w>Cape</w> can be very heavy on Friday afternoons.

senses.sense_definition: A short form for the Cape of Good Hope or the surrounding region in South Africa.

examples.text: He just moved to Johannesburg from the <w>Cape</w>.
The wines produced in the <w>Cape</w> are famous around the world.

senses.sense_definition: A short form for Cape Canaveral in Florida, United States, known for space launches.

examples.text: The rocket is scheduled to launch from the <w>Cape</w> tomorrow morning.
Engineers at the <w>Cape</w> are preparing for the next mission.

senses.sense_definition: To defend or praise someone, especially when they do not deserve it.

examples.text: I cannot believe you are <w>caping</w> for a politician who lied to everyone.
Stop <w>caping</w> for him; he needs to take responsibility for his own actions.

senses.sense_definition: To incite or attract a bull to charge in a certain direction by waving a cape.

examples.text: The young matador learned how to <w>cape</w> the bull with grace and precision.
He spent years in the fields <w>caping</w> bulls before his professional debut.
